ayas.translation: Noon. I swear by the pen and what the angels write,
ayas.transliteration: nūn ۚ wal qalami wa mā yasṭurūn

ayas.translation: By the grace of your Lord you are not mad.
And most surely you shall have a reward never to be cut off.
ayas.transliteration: wa inna laka la-ajran ghayra mamnūn

ayas.translation: And most surely you conform (yourself) to sublime morality.
So you shall see, and they (too) shall see,
Which of you is afflicted with madness.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
ayas.translation: Surely your Lord best knows him who errs from His way, and He best knows the followers of the right course.
ayas.transliteration: inna rabbaka huwa a`lamu biman ḍalla `an sabīlihi wahuwa a`lamu bil muhtadīn

ayas.translation: So do not yield to the rejecters.
They wish that you should be pliant so they (too) would be pliant.
And yield not to any mean swearer
Defamer, going about with slander
Forbidder of good, outstepping the limits, sinful,
Ignoble, besides all that, base-born;
Because he possesses wealth and sons.

ayas.arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
ayas.translation: When Our communications are recited to him, he says: Stories of those of yore.
We will brand him on the nose.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
ayas.translation: Surely We will try them as We tried the owners of the garden, when they swore that they would certainly cut off the produce in the morning,
ayas.transliteration: innā balawnāhum kamā balawnā aṣ-ḥābal jannati idh aqsamū layaṣrimunnahā muṣbiḥīn

ayas.translation: And were not willing to set aside a portion (for the poor).

ayas.arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
ayas.translation: Then there encompassed it a visitation from your Lord while they were sleeping.
ayas.transliteration: faṭāfa `alayhā ṭā-ifun min rabbika wahum nā-imūn

ayas.translation: So it became as black, barren land.
And they called out to each other in the morning,

ayas.arabic: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰرِمِينَ
ayas.translation: Saying: Go early to your tilth if you would cut (the produce).
So they went, while they consulted together secretly,

ayas.arabic: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
ayas.translation: Saying: No poor man shall enter it today upon you.
And in the morning they went, having the power to prevent.
But when they saw it, they said: Most surely we have gone astray
Nay! we are made to suffer privation.

ayas.arabic: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
ayas.translation: The best of them said: Did I not say to you, Why do you not glorify (Allah)?
ayas.transliteration: qāla awsaṭuhum alam aqul lakum lawlā tusabbiḥūn

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: They said: Glory be to our Lord, surely we were unjust.
ayas.transliteration: qālū subḥāna rabbinā innā kunnā ẓālimīn

ayas.translation: Then some of them advanced against others, blaming each other.
Said they: O woe to us! surely we were inordinate:

ayas.arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
ayas.translation: Maybe, our Lord will give us instead one better than it; surely to our Lord do we make our humble petition.
ayas.transliteration: `asā rabbunā an yubdilanā khayran minhā innā ilā rabbinā rāghibūn

ayas.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: Such is the chastisement, and certainly the chastisement of the hereafter is greater, did they but know!
ayas.transliteration: kadhālikal `adhāb ۖ wala`adhābul-ākhirati akbar ۚ law kānū ya`lamūn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
ayas.translation: Surely those who guard (against evil) shall have with their Lord gardens of bliss.
What! shall We then make (that is, treat) those who submit as the guilty?
What has happened to you? How do you judge?
Or have you a book wherein you read,
That you have surely therein what you choose?

ayas.arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
ayas.translation: Or have you received from Us an agreement confirmed by an oath extending to the day of resurrection that you shall surely have what you demand?
ayas.transliteration: am lakum aymānun `alaynā bālighatun ilā yawmil qiyāmati inna lakum lamā taḥkumūn

ayas.translation: Ask them which of them will vouch for that,

ayas.arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
ayas.translation: Or have they associates if they are truthful.
ayas.transliteration: am lahum shurakā-u falya-tū bishurakā-ihim in kānū ṣādiqīn

ayas.arabic: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
ayas.translation: On the day when there shall be a severe affliction, and they shall be called upon to make obeisance, but they shall not be able,
ayas.transliteration: yawma yukshafu `an sāqin wayud`awna ilas sujūdi falā yastaṭī`ūn

ayas.arabic: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: Their looks cast down, abasement shall overtake them; and they were called upon to make obeisance indeed while yet they were safe.
ayas.transliteration: khāshi`atan abṣāruhum tarhaquhum dhillah ۖ waqad kānū yud`awna ilas sujūdi wahum sālimūn

ayas.arabic: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: So leave Me and him who rejects this announcement; We will overtake them by degrees, from whence they perceive not:
ayas.transliteration: fadharnī wa man yukadhhibu bihādhal ḥadīth ۖ sanastadrijuhum min ḥaythu lā ya`lamūn

ayas.translation: And I do bear with them, surely My plan is firm.

ayas.arabic: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
ayas.translation: Or do you ask from them a reward, so that they are burdened with debt?
ayas.transliteration: am tas-aluhum ajran fahum min maghramin muthqalūn

ayas.translation: Or have they (the knowledge of) the unseen, so that they write (it) down?

ayas.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
ayas.translation: So wait patiently for the judgment of your Lord, and be not like the companion of the fish, when he cried while he was in distress.
ayas.transliteration: faṣbir liḥukmi rabbika walā takun kaṣāḥibil ḥūti idh nādā wahuwa makẓūm

ayas.arabic: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
ayas.translation: Were it not that favor from his Lord had overtaken him, he would certainly have been cast down upon the naked Found while he was blamed.
ayas.transliteration: lawlā an tadārakahu ni`matun min rabbihi lanubidha bil `arā-i wahuwa madhmūm

ayas.translation: Then his Lord chose him, and He made him of the good.

ayas.arabic: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
ayas.translation: And those who disbelieve would almost smite you with their eyes when they hear the reminder, and they say: Most surely he is mad.
ayas.transliteration: wa in yakādul ladhīna kafarū layuzliqūnaka bi-abṣārihim lammā sami`udh dhikra wayaqūlūna innahu lamajnūn

ayas.translation: And it is naught but a reminder to the nations.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā huwa illā dhikrul lil`ālamīn
